1.0.0:
Initial Release

Release Date: **April 4, 2018**

Author/s: Ava Thorn (avthorn@cisco.com)

Change History:
- Added basic functionality for connections to spark API
- Added ability to list, add, and remove yourself from the queue
- Added admins
- Added admin commands to show people, and show stats as markdown table
- Added admin ability to add and remove other admins
- Added global admins
- Added easter eggs
1.1.0:
Release Date: **April 8, 2018**

Author/s: Ava Thorn (avthorn@cisco.com)

Change History:
- Added estimated wait times displayed whenever "list" or "how long" is issued
- Added integration tests covering 99% of queuebot
- Added about and version commands to display queuebot metadata
- Added queue threshold limits to 50
- Added ability to get all stats as a csv file
- Added ability for admins to remove and add other people
- Added statistics for display max/average/min queue depth and flush time by hour
- Added matplotlib to show statistics as graphs
- Added Ability to show quickest and most active users
- Added an admin manager to manage admins for a project
- Added global statistics and migrated where data is stored for each project
- Added show release notes command
1.2.0:
Release Date: **???**

Author/s: Ava Thorn (avthorn@cisco.com)

Change History:
- Added project manager
- Updated graphs to be line graphs instead of bar graphs
- Added ability to create and delete projects
- Updated show admins screen to distinguish between global admins and project admins
- Added global admin commands
- Added ability for projects to become stale
- Added ability to create and delete projects
- Updated registration to only work if you're an admin on the target project
- Updated status to be more accurate
- Added subprojects
- Added strict regex setting and default enforce strict regex to ensure nondeterminism
- Added 'delete last message' command
- Added ability to specified which version of release notes to show
- Added statistics for display max/average/min queue depth and flush time by day
- Updated add and remove commands to only send one message
